content.title: World | Latest News & Updates | BBC News
content.metaDescription: Get all the latest news, live updates and content about the World from across the BBC.
content.content:
# 

# World
[LIVE ## Israel returns more bodies of Palestinians as US downplays threat to Gaza ceasefire After Hamas handed over two dead Israeli hostages overnight, Israel returns 30 dead Palestinians - a ratio agreed in the first phase of the peace deal.](https://www.bbc.com/news/live/ckgzndpnjl1t)[## Trump says he authorised CIA in Venezuela as Maduro says 'no to regime change' Trump would not be drawn on whether the CIA was seeking to topple Maduro. 49 mins agoWorld](/news/articles/c0ex1jq9pdvo)[## Andrew believed having sex with me was his birthright, Giuffre claimed in memoir Virginia Giuffre, who took her life earlier this year, gives her account of meeting Prince Andrew. 14 hrs agoUK](/news/articles/c0kpjyjyrlno)[## Titan submersible imploded due to poor engineering, say US officials The submersible disappeared from sensors on its journey to the wreck of the Titanic, killing all five people on board. 3 hrs agoUS & Canada](/news/articles/cdeg7y4171xo)[## French PM Sébastien Lecornu survives two no-confidence votes by MPs Lecornu - who only took the job in September - resigned earlier this month, before being reappointed. The first vote to remove him fell short by just 18 votes.](https://www.bbc.com/news/live/cp8y7e59d8gt)[## Russia intensifies attacks on Ukraine's trains in 'battle for the railways' In the last two months, Russia has hugely upped its attacks on Ukraine's trains and rail network. 13 hrs agoEurope](/news/articles/cvgdepnqk2jo)[## 'I can't afford to save both twins': Sudan's war left one mother with an impossible choice The destruction and hunger that Sudan's war has brought leaves parents with some impossible choices. 13 hrs agoAfrica](/news/articles/cre5rng5808o)[## Huge crowds welcome body of former PM Odinga to Kenya A sudden influx of mourners prompted authorities to relocate the public viewing ceremony.](/news/articles/cwyk1l65nqvo)[## China sacks officials over viral Arc'teryx fireworks show in Tibet Videos of fireworks resembling a "rising dragon" erupting over Himalayan foothills had drawn backlash.](/news/articles/c1lq4305336o)[## S Korea tycoon escapes paying $1bn in 'divorce of the century' The high court has struck down an order for Chey Tae-won to pay a record divorce settlement to his ex-wife.](/news/articles/c2drpd1pwrno)[## Trump says Modi has agreed to stop buying Russian oil The US president says the move is "a big stop", but there has been no confirmation so far from Delhi.](/news/articles/ce8gdl54n1go)[## ChatGPT will soon allow erotica for verified adults, says OpenAI boss CEO Sam Altman says upcoming versions of the popular chatbot would enable it to behave in a more human-like way - "but only if you want it".](/news/articles/cpd2qv58yl5o)
## Features
[## 'Worse than starting from scratch': How big is the task of rebuilding Gaza? BBC Verify investigates the damage done by two years of war, which could take $70bn and decades to repair.](/news/articles/cr5e4ee9r13o)[## Months after fall of Assad, families of Syria's missing still seeking justice Some are only now coming forward with accounts of loved ones who disappeared during the civil war and are presumed dead.](/news/articles/cj07p5zm229o)[## China arrested 30 Christians. Some fear it's the start of a bigger crackdown Activists say the unprecedented round-up could be the beginning of a wider crackdown on China's underground churches.](/news/articles/cx2pez2vg8wo)[## Bowen: Trump's role in Gaza ceasefire was decisive, but not a roadmap to peace Trump's Middle East visit was a victory lap - but peace does not emerge just because a president decides it.](/news/articles/ce86118q6ego)[## Spain's radically different approach to African migration Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez's government is kicking against the prevailing mood among Western nations.](/news/articles/cn409ld50kvo)
## Watch/Listen
[## Watch: Police fire tear gas at protesters in Peru Police fired tear gas at protesters who could be seen sheltering in doorways.](/news/videos/c993r08kp89o)[## Watch: Freed detainee finds family alive after thinking they had been killed Shadi Abu Sido told the BBC an Israeli prison officer said his family had been killed.](/news/videos/c7516x2zy6ko)[## Watch: Moment house drifts away from land as typhoon hits Alaska The US Coast Guard rescued two dozen people after their homes floated away from shore during the storm.](/news/videos/c07mndrgerpo)[## Crowds in Madagascar cheer as military unit seizes power Crowds celebrated in the streets of the capital Antananarivo after an elite army unit said it had seized power from the president.](/news/videos/c797ndpd97lo)
## Latest updates
[Just now ## Huge crowds welcome body of former PM Odinga to Kenya A sudden influx of mourners prompted authorities to relocate the public viewing ceremony.](/news/articles/cwyk1l65nqvo)[7 mins ago ## Palestinian leader Marwan Barghouti attacked by prison guards, family says The alleged attack on the 66-year-old, who is serving life for murder, is said to have left him unconscious - but Israel's prison service calls the claim "fake".](/news/articles/cpwvr2xpkz0o)[18 mins ago ## The unanswered questions after release of China spy evidence The disclosure sheds more light than ever before on what the two men were accused of, but raises new questions for the prime minister and prosecutors.](/news/articles/cp3x55rqdy5o)[36 mins ago ## Canada threatens Jeep-maker over proposed US move The company wants to move production of its Jeep Compass model from Ontario to Illinois.](/news/articles/cn97xx7d3r1o)[52 mins ago ## Last surviving member of first team to scale Everest dies aged 92 Kanchha Sherpa was 19 when he accompanied the team led by Edmund Hillary and Tenzing Norgay to the summit in 1953.](/news/articles/ceq0xlnv2x2o)[2 hrs ago ## Mamdani v Cuomo: What to watch for in New York mayoral debate In an unusual race, a young Democratic socialist is leading an establishment politician by a wide margin.](/news/articles/cj97jpx3yj3o)[2 hrs ago ## Labuschagne hits another ton to push for Ashes recall A resurgent Marnus Labuschagne scores his fourth century in five innings to further press his case for a recall to Australia's side for the Ashes.](/sport/cricket/articles/c0qpddx17qko)[2 hrs ago ## From prison to presidential palace: Who is Madagascar's new military ruler? Before the last weekend, most people in Madagascar had no clue who Col Michael Randrianirina was.](/news/articles/cj6ne96gx1do)[2 hrs ago ## Convicted ex-president Kabila rallies opposition to 'save' DR Congo from crisis Joseph Kabila appears in Kenya with other opposition leaders two weeks after being sentenced to death.](/news/articles/cy8v79rnmvpo)[1](https://www.bbc.com/news/world?automation=true%3Fautomation%3Dtrue&wait-for-init-args=true&page=1)[2](https://www.bbc.com/news/world?automation=true%3Fautomation%3Dtrue&wait-for-init-args=true&page=2)[3](https://www.bbc.com/news/world?automation=true%3Fautomation%3Dtrue&wait-for-init-args=true&page=3)[4](https://www.bbc.com/news/world?automation=true%3Fautomation%3Dtrue&wait-for-init-args=true&page=4)[5](https://www.bbc.com/news/world?automation=true%3Fautomation%3Dtrue&wait-for-init-args=true&page=5)...[12](https://www.bbc.com/news/world?automation=true%3Fautomation%3Dtrue&wait-for-init-args=true&page=12)

links.text: LIVEIsrael returns more bodies of Palestinians as US downplays threat to Gaza ceasefireAfter Hamas handed over two dead Israeli hostages overnight, Israel returns 30 dead Palestinians - a ratio agreed in the first phase of the peace deal.
Trump says he authorised CIA in Venezuela as Maduro says 'no to regime change'Trump would not be drawn on whether the CIA was seeking to topple Maduro. 49 mins agoWorld

Titan submersible imploded due to poor engineering, say US officialsThe submersible disappeared from sensors on its journey to the wreck of the Titanic, killing all five people on board.3 hrs agoUS & Canada
Trump says he authorised CIA in Venezuela as Maduro says 'no to regime change'Trump would not be drawn on whether the CIA was seeking to topple Maduro. 49 mins agoWorld

French PM Sébastien Lecornu survives two no-confidence votes by MPsLecornu - who only took the job in September - resigned earlier this month, before being reappointed. The first vote to remove him fell short by just 18 votes.
Russia intensifies attacks on Ukraine's trains in 'battle for the railways'In the last two months, Russia has hugely upped its attacks on Ukraine's trains and rail network.13 hrs agoEurope

'I can't afford to save both twins': Sudan's war left one mother with an impossible choiceThe destruction and hunger that Sudan's war has brought leaves parents with some impossible choices.13 hrs agoAfrica
Huge crowds welcome body of former PM Odinga to KenyaA sudden influx of mourners prompted authorities to relocate the public viewing ceremony.
China sacks officials over viral Arc'teryx fireworks show in TibetVideos of fireworks resembling a "rising dragon" erupting over Himalayan foothills had drawn backlash.
S Korea tycoon escapes paying $1bn in 'divorce of the century'The high court has struck down an order for Chey Tae-won to pay a record divorce settlement to his ex-wife.
Trump says Modi has agreed to stop buying Russian oilThe US president says the move is "a big stop", but there has been no confirmation so far from Delhi.

ChatGPT will soon allow erotica for verified adults, says OpenAI boss CEO Sam Altman says upcoming versions of the popular chatbot would enable it to behave in a more human-like way  - "but only if you want it".
'Worse than starting from scratch': How big is the task of rebuilding Gaza?BBC Verify investigates the damage done by two years of war, which could take $70bn and decades to repair.
Months after fall of Assad, families of Syria's missing still seeking justiceSome are only now coming forward with accounts of loved ones who disappeared during the civil war and are presumed dead.
China arrested 30 Christians. Some fear it's the start of a bigger crackdownActivists say the unprecedented round-up could be the beginning of a wider crackdown on China's underground churches.
Bowen: Trump's role in Gaza ceasefire was decisive, but not a roadmap to peaceTrump's Middle East visit was a victory lap - but peace does not emerge just because a president decides it.
Spain's radically different approach to African migrationPrime Minister Pedro Sanchez's government is kicking against the prevailing mood among Western nations.
Watch: Police fire tear gas at protesters in PeruPolice fired tear gas at protesters who could be seen sheltering in doorways.
Watch: Freed detainee finds family alive after thinking they had been killedShadi Abu Sido told the BBC an Israeli prison officer said his family had been killed.
Watch: Moment house drifts away from land as typhoon hits AlaskaThe US Coast Guard rescued two dozen people after their homes floated away from shore during the storm.
Crowds in Madagascar cheer as military unit seizes powerCrowds celebrated in the streets of the capital Antananarivo after an elite army unit said it had seized power from the president.
Just nowHuge crowds welcome body of former PM Odinga to KenyaA sudden influx of mourners prompted authorities to relocate the public viewing ceremony.Just now

7 mins agoPalestinian leader Marwan Barghouti attacked by prison guards, family saysThe alleged attack on the 66-year-old, who is serving life for murder, is said to have left him unconscious - but Israel's prison service calls the claim "fake". 7 mins ago

18 mins agoThe unanswered questions after release of China spy evidenceThe disclosure sheds more light than ever before on what the two men were accused of, but raises new questions for the prime minister and prosecutors.18 mins ago
36 mins agoCanada threatens Jeep-maker over proposed US moveThe company wants to move production of its Jeep Compass model from Ontario to Illinois.36 mins ago

52 mins agoLast surviving member of first team to scale Everest dies aged 92Kanchha Sherpa was 19 when he accompanied the team led by Edmund Hillary and Tenzing Norgay to the summit in 1953. 52 mins ago
2 hrs agoMamdani v Cuomo: What to watch for in New York mayoral debateIn an unusual race, a young Democratic socialist is leading an establishment politician by a wide margin. 2 hrs ago

2 hrs agoLabuschagne hits another ton to push for Ashes recallA resurgent Marnus Labuschagne scores his fourth century in five innings to further press his case for a recall to Australia's side for the Ashes.2 hrs ago
2 hrs agoFrom prison to presidential palace: Who is Madagascar's new military ruler?Before the last weekend, most people in Madagascar had no clue who Col Michael Randrianirina was.2 hrs ago
2 hrs agoConvicted ex-president Kabila rallies opposition to 'save' DR Congo from crisisJoseph Kabila appears in Kenya with other opposition leaders two weeks after being sentenced to death.2 hrs ago

images.alt: An elderly couple grieves in front of their destroyed home as Palestinians, carrying what belongings they could with them, returning to the Shuja'iyya neighborhood after the ceasefire agreement came into effect are seen walking among buildings destroyed in attacks by the Israeli army on October 16, 2025 in Gaza City, Gaza.
President Donald Trump in the Oval Office on 15 October 2025
Touma, a Sudanese mother wearing a headscarf holding her baby who has a drip in her nose
President Donald Trump in the Oval Office on 15 October 2025
French Prime Minister Sebastien Lecornu shakes hands with French Education Minister Edouard Geffray after the results of the votes on two no-confidence motions
damaged train
Touma, a Sudanese mother wearing a headscarf holding her baby who has a drip in her nose
Mourners stand on a grounded aeroplane and elephant sculptures
Clouds of colourful smoke rise from a fireworks display over hills, with the snow-capped peaks of the Himalayas in the distance
Close-up photo of Chey Tae-won speaking on a microphone wearing a suit and tie against a blurred blue and white background
Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi in Mumbai, India, on 9 October 2025
The OpenAI logo and company name are displayed against the backdrop of a darkened keyboard

A designed image with BBC Verify branding in blue and a Gazan man with a grey beard wearing a checked T-shirt and a backwards baseball cap, who is carrying a long bundle of wood which appears to be salvaged from a damaged building, partially wrapped in a red cloth. Behind him in the blurred background is a dusty road and ruined buildings.
Young woman holds photo of missing man
Jin Mingri is wearing a blue blazer and white collared shirt, sitting in a row of red upholstered seats in a church auditorium
US President Donald Trump, standing at podium, delivering a speech at a summit in Sharm El-Sheikh, Egypt.
Spain's prime minister Pedro Sanchez delivers a speech. Behind him is a sign in Spanish that says Spain-Africa 2025-2028.
Demonstrators clash with riot police officers during a protest in Lima, Peru
A Palestinian man embraces his smiling children in Gaza.
A house submerged almost up to its roof floats in water near land.
Women with raised arms, cheering in a crowd
Mourners stand on a grounded aeroplane and elephant sculptures
Palestinian Marwan Barghouti looks into the camera, his arms raised, while surrounded by Israeli prison guards (file photo)
Keir Starmer speaks during the Prime Minister's Questions at the House of Commons

A mostly white white Jeep Compass SUV with some black trip, The car looks to be driving in an American neighbourhood and takes up most of the picture - some cars and buildings can be seen in the background
Kanchha Sherpa. File photo

In a composite image, Andrew Cuomo, wearing a blue suit coat and white shirt, smiles and waves as he walks through a crowd while Zohran Mamdani, in a dark suit and patterned tie, speaks into a megaphone.
Marnus Labuschagne holds his bat aloft
A close up headshot of Col Michael Randrianirina. He is wearing military fatigues.
Former President of the Democratic Republic of Congo Joseph Kabila (in dark suit) gestures during a meeting with traditional leaders at one of his residences in Goma on May 30, 2025
